folder: Richmond Avenue & Forest Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
Richmond Avenue, east side, between Forest Avenue and Monsey Place. Mr. Sperr refers to this house as the D. C. Decker House. On Beers's 1874 map it appears as the J. Simonson house.
January 4, 1924
By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr

folder: Richmond Avenue & Forest Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
Richmond Avenue, east side, between Forest Avenue and Snow Street, showing the barn on the David C. Decker property. Mr. P.L. Sperr states that the windows are from a church that once stood in Hillside Cemetery.
January 4, 1924.
By Wm. T. Davis through P.L. Sperr
(2)
A view of the rear of the barn. It stands 150 feet back
of the avenue.
January 4, 1924.
P.L. Sperr

folder: Forest Avenue & Richmond Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
Forest Avenue, near Richmond Avenue, showing two old railroad cars that have been converted into a residence.
May 1927.
P.L. Sperr

folder: Forest Avenue & Richmond Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
Forest Avenue, adjoining the N.E. corner of Richmond Avenue.
May 21, 1932
P.L. Sperr
